The present study is undertaken among 812 university students in order to examine the relationship between these variables. Methods: The sample included 812 university students - 361 men (44.46%) and 451 women (55.54%) - who participated voluntarily. The Positive and Negative Affect Scale, Subjective Happiness Scale and Self-Esteem Scale were the instruments used in this study. Results: The results revealed that men have greater self-esteem and positive affects, while women scored higher in terms of subjective happiness. The analysis revealed a significant correlation between the variables under analysis. Positive affects show a strong positive correlation between self-esteem and happiness, while negative affects show a negative correlation. Mediation analysis suggests that affects, both positive and negative, mediate the relationship between self-esteem and subjective happiness. The results of this study may present us with new perspectives concerning the role that affects play between self-esteem and happiness. Conclusion: The data present evidence of the mediating role-played by affects, both positive and negative, in the relationship between self-esteem and happiness. More research is needed to examine to what extent these results can be extrapolated, and how to design measures to improve psychological health and well-being.","published_in":"","year":"2020-06-09T10:36:16Z","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Salavera, C.; Usan, P.; Teruel, P.","link":"http:\/\/zaguan.unizar.es\/record\/89595","oa_state":"1","url":"b1e885f162d1ad4bf8891aedb281864e037eba39c0e7ac32933c3b0eb66ba58b","relevance":85,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"45ed4649152d1201acd4dd1a10734ae72d4e5a17e932a0d590e1e2fe388838a0","relation":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1177\/2158244020940695; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/2158-2440; 2158-2440; doi:10.1177\/2158244020940695; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/40b6bae7f8634c538964578b81246a49","identifier":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1177\/2158244020940695; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/40b6bae7f8634c538964578b81246a49","title":"Happiness Among Malaysian Adolescents: The Role of Sociodemographic Factors and Everyday Events","paper_abstract":"The purpose of this study is to examine how sociodemographic factors and everyday events are related to adolescent\u2019s happiness in Malaysia. A total of 1,766 adolescents from 20 secondary schools in peninsular Malaysia completed a questionnaire on demographic background information and Malay version of Oxford Happiness Questionnaire. Participants were also requested to identify everyday events that made them happy in the last 6 months. Univariate analysis of variance (ANOVA) was run to determine effects of gender, ethnicity, religion, and location on happiness. None of the main effects and interactions were significant. Correlation analysis revealed that household income, income of father, education of father, education of mother, and academic performance were significantly associated with adolescent\u2019s happiness. Analysis of the everyday events that were reported to induce happiness suggested these events as related to domains considered salient in an adolescent\u2019s life, including family, friends, and school. Everyday events are also related to intentional activities. Findings provide better understanding of the key demographic factors and everyday events that contribute to happiness of adolescents in Malaysia. Findings particularly suggest the importance of intentional activities in increasing happiness among adolescents.","published_in":"SAGE Open, Vol 10 (2020)","year":"2020-07-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"History of scholarship and learning. For this purpose, this study focused on the causal relationships among the frequency of exercise, self-esteem, stress, depression, school satisfaction and degree of happiness in elementary, junior high and high school students (n = 11,132) in South Korea. The data used for this study were collected in 2016 by the National Youth Policy Institute (NYPI) for the \u201cUN convention on the rights of the child.\u201d The results were as follows; firstly, the exercise frequency had a significant causal relationship with self-esteem, stress, school satisfaction and happiness but not with depression. However, it was found that exercise frequency had an indirect effect on depression through stress. In detail, exercise frequency could positively reduce stress, and less stress affects depression. Secondly, there were significant direct or indirect effects on self-esteem, stress, depression, degree of happiness and school satisfaction. In this research, we employ the data collected in Chinese General Social Survey in 2013 and adopt the semiparametric estimation methodology of ordered probit model. Our main findings include the following. First, compared with the residents without higher education, residents with high education enjoy better health conditions, and residents' happiness also significantly affects their health conditions. Second, higher education may have a long-term impact on residents' health by affecting their happiness. Third, the results of grouping test demonstrate that, with the increase in age, the influence of residents' happiness on health is more pronounced, but the mechanism of higher education to improve health status by improving residents' happiness becomes unobvious. Furthermore, we adopt the Shapley value decomposition methodology to decompose the effects of various factors on residents' health. We find that with the increase in age, happiness contributes more and more to residents' health conditions.","published_in":"Frontiers in Psychology, Vol 11 (2020)","year":"2020-07-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"higher education; happiness; health; semiparameter estimation; shapley value decomposition; Psychology; BF1-990","subject":"higher education; happiness; health; semiparameter estimation; shapley value decomposition; Psychology; ","authors":"Hong Tan; Jin Luo; Ming Zhang","link":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01669","oa_state":"1","url":"09e424362dd881a386fb92b56bcb69921f43fbfa68f72e2d46a257a8cbac22fe","relevance":82,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01669"},{"id":"ac9637d0d09f4b31000a67a02b80c7a0d98f470ea3aed9265275a5e00de8b8c3","relation":"http:\/\/eprints.nottingham.ac.uk\/61479\/1\/ilovepdf_merged%20%2832%29.pdf; Jin, Zhizhou and Zeng, Saixing and Cao, Cong and Ma, Hanyang and Sun, Daxin (2020) Impacts of pollution abatement projects on happiness: an exploratory study in China. ISSN 09596526; doi:10.1016\/j.jclepro.2020.122869","identifier":"http:\/\/eprints.nottingham.ac.uk\/61479\/; http:\/\/eprints.nottingham.ac.uk\/61479\/1\/ilovepdf_merged%20%2832%29.pdf; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1016\/j.jclepro.2020.122869","title":"Impacts of pollution abatement projects on happiness: an exploratory study in China","paper_abstract":"Pollution has been a global concern in recent decades, promoting related actions in an increasing number of areas. While pollution can lead to unhappiness, will pollution abatement simply increase people's happiness? We analyze relevant happiness data collected before and after China's South-to-North Water Diversion Eastern Route Pollution Control Project to test this idea. The empirical results indicate that the pollution abatement project may not enhance happiness in its duration. Some residents may temporarily sacrifice something (such as employment or income), which offsets the positive effect of environmental improvement on their happiness. In subgroup analyses, rural people are found to benefit more from environmental improvement and suffer less in happiness compared with the urban, and so are low-income people compared with the high-income ones. The findings offer new insights into the costs of pollution in terms of happiness and highlight the need to abate pollution meticulously. \u00a9 2020 Elsevier Ltd","published_in":"","year":"2020-07-17","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Jin, Zhizhou; Zeng, Saixing; Cao, Cong; Ma, Hanyang; Sun, Daxin","link":"http:\/\/eprints.nottingham.ac.uk\/61479\/","oa_state":"1","url":"ac9637d0d09f4b31000a67a02b80c7a0d98f470ea3aed9265275a5e00de8b8c3","relevance":81,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"1ceffa8f1d1a16c339b0137c115c304a8c31ddfaa9a854585d8f774c8d25a0e5","relation":"https:\/\/ejournal.upi.edu\/index.php\/insight\/article\/view\/24598\/11862; https:\/\/ejournal.upi.edu\/index.php\/insight\/article\/view\/24598","identifier":"https:\/\/ejournal.upi.edu\/index.php\/insight\/article\/view\/24598","title":"PEMAAFAN DAN KEBAHAGIAAN PADA LANSIA","paper_abstract":"The purpose of this research is to identify the relationship between forgiveness and happiness in elderly at Wredha Abiyoso Pakem Yogyakarta house. Therefore, we propose a novel approach of applying machine learning, a branch of the field of artificial intelligence, to a variety of information concerning people's lives (i.e., a lifelog). We asked a participant (a healthy young man) to record 55 lifelog items (e.g., positive mood, negative events, sleep time etc.) in his daily life for about eight months using smartphone apps and a smartwatch. We then constructed a predictor to estimate the degree of happiness from the multimodal lifelog data using a support vector machine, which achieved 82.6% prediction accuracy. This suggests that our approach can predict the behaviors that increase individuals' happiness in their daily lives, thereby contributing to improvement in their happiness. Future studies examining the usability and clinical applicability of this approach would benefit from a larger and more diverse sample size.","published_in":"","year":"2020-05","subject_orig":"machine learning; lifelog; artificial intelligence; happiness; behavior","subject":"machine learning; lifelog; artificial intelligence; happiness; behavior","authors":"YamamotoI, Tetsuya; Yoshimoto, Junichiro; Murillo-Rodriguez, Eric; Machado, Sergio","link":"http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/10061\/14117","oa_state":"1","url":"bcf3c5f0c03545333808850bdaf410db559c7acba3f1e6fdeb922dea0724086d","relevance":78,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"c3f1ed15dc5250a7644bd7b7c8519e7d0a3814e83df0c0b046f2d07b7eb3ca1f","relation":"1863-6683; http:\/\/dx.doi.org\/10.1007\/s11846-018-0301-4; http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/11536\/154461; doi:10.1007\/s11846-018-0301-4; REVIEW OF MANAGERIAL SCIENCE; WOS:000529687100005","identifier":"http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/11536\/154461; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1007\/s11846-018-0301-4","title":"Modeling knowledge sharing and team performance in technology industry: the main and moderating effects of happiness","paper_abstract":"This study complements previous literature by bridging activity theory and the broaden-and-build theory to examine how happiness (as an intrinsic driver) and knowledge sharing (as an extrinsic driver) influence team performance. The contributions of this study are twofolds. First, this study fills a research gap concerning what mediates the simultaneous influences of happiness and knowledge sharing on team performance. Second, both main and moderating effects of happiness in the development of team performance are explored in this study, which is rarely discussed in the literature. By surveying 116 teams from high-tech firms in Taiwan, this study opens a black box regarding the mediation of team proactivity and team proficiency and the moderation of happiness in the development of team performance. Lastly, managerial implications and limitations based on the empirical findings are provided.","published_in":"","year":"2020-06-01","subject_orig":"Happiness; Knowledge sharing; Team proactivity; Team proficiency; Team performance","subject":"Happiness; Knowledge sharing; Team proactivity; Team proficiency; Team performance","authors":"Liu, Min-Ling; Hsieh, Meng-Wen; Hsiao, Chan; Lin, Chieh-Peng; Yang, Chyan","link":"http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/11536\/154461","oa_state":"2","url":"c3f1ed15dc5250a7644bd7b7c8519e7d0a3814e83df0c0b046f2d07b7eb3ca1f","relevance":77,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"a97afa3be51c4e6c1d4b2f8288a8caf3ddc821a613eb738bf110c88dff398e50","relation":"https:\/\/lup.lub.lu.se\/record\/576e0929-b8c2-4523-bba7-8d8188cb7a47; http:\/\/dx.doi.org\/10.1016\/j.frl.2020.101599; scopus:85085651864","identifier":"https:\/\/lup.lub.lu.se\/record\/576e0929-b8c2-4523-bba7-8d8188cb7a47; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1016\/j.frl.2020.101599","title":"Happiness and Gold Prices","paper_abstract":"We use the Twitter-based Hedonometer happiness index to study the link between happiness and gold price changes. We find no significant correlation between the two when we look at correlations across the entire distributions. However, turning to an extreme value theory (EVT) modeling of the tails of the non-normally distributed happiness distribution we find that during particularly depressing days the gold price often goes up. In a sense, gold is found to serve as a happiness-related safe haven, i.e. as a hedge against extreme unhappiness.","published_in":"Finance Research Letters; 35(July 2020), no 101599 (2020) ; ISSN: 1544-6123","year":"2020-05-26","subject_orig":"Economics; extreme value theory; gold price; happiness; Hedonometer; tail; Twitter","subject":"Economics; extreme value theory; gold price; happiness; Hedonometer; tail; Twitter","authors":"Bystr\u00f6m, Hans","link":"https:\/\/lup.lub.lu.se\/record\/576e0929-b8c2-4523-bba7-8d8188cb7a47","oa_state":"2","url":"a97afa3be51c4e6c1d4b2f8288a8caf3ddc821a613eb738bf110c88dff398e50","relevance":76,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"04dd4ddfa7ebee8a354bc2f162b11548e48404518abbb3590584938881068d28","relation":"http:\/\/repo.lib.tokushima-u.ac.jp\/files\/public\/11\/114837\/20200601164657860272\/jpcpy_11_2_56.pdf; 23736445; http:\/\/repo.lib.tokushima-u.ac.jp\/114837","identifier":"http:\/\/repo.lib.tokushima-u.ac.jp\/114837","title":"Recognition of happiness from subjective, psychological and neuroimaging points of view","paper_abstract":"The goal of the medical practice and medical research may include the happiness and health of body and soul. The phrase \u201chappy people live longer\u201d has been known. Subjective Happiness Scale (SHS) can be used for the study for feeling of happiness. By functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMR), anterior right wedge region of the brain (precuneus) may be important for feeing happiness. Both of effective and functional connectivity of the right precuneus were positively associated with SHS scores. Consequently, happiness may be involved in SHS, structural neuroimaging, neurological study, positive psychological interventions, and so on.","published_in":"","year":"2020-06-11","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Bando, Hiroshi","link":"http:\/\/repo.lib.tokushima-u.ac.jp\/114837","oa_state":"1","url":"04dd4ddfa7ebee8a354bc2f162b11548e48404518abbb3590584938881068d28","relevance":75,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"c0e0a86b1db0c8270f8a3c7faf2cedc6d07f26cd9d37021003dca8e89171dd4e","relation":"http:\/\/visnuk-archiv.ubs.edu.ua\/article\/view\/208380\/208680; http:\/\/visnuk-archiv.ubs.edu.ua\/article\/view\/208380","identifier":"http:\/\/visnuk-archiv.ubs.edu.ua\/article\/view\/208380","title":"MEASUREMENTS OF HAPPINESS AT THE UNIVERSITY IN THE CONTEXT OF THE ECONOMY OF HAPPINESS ; \u0412\u0418\u041c\u0406\u0420\u0418 \u0429\u0410\u0421\u0422\u042f \u0412 \u0423\u041d\u0406\u0412\u0415\u0420\u0421\u0418\u0422\u0415\u0422\u0406 \u0412 \u041a\u041e\u041d\u0422\u0415\u041a\u0421\u0422\u0406 \u0415\u041a\u041e\u041d\u041e\u041c\u0406\u041a\u0418 \u0429\u0410\u0421\u0422\u042f","paper_abstract":"The article describes theoretical, methodological approaches to defining and measuring the economy of happiness. The theoretical basis of the economy of happiness involves the study of economic and other factors that determine human happiness, its dependence on the level of economic development of the country and determine the parameters for assessing the level of happiness of society as a whole. The \u00abEasterlin paradox\u00bb is highlighted, which notes the limited impact of economic growth on the level of happiness of citizens. Theeconomy of happiness at the macro level is due to happiness at the micro level, in our study - at the University. Its purpose was to determine the level and measure the factors of happiness, and their impact, taking into account modern network communications on the productivity and creativity of students and teachers. The article presents the results of a study of 323 students and teachers of various higher education institutions of Ukraine, interviewed using a cloud questionary created using Google Form. The results of the study showed that most students and teachers are satisfied with life in higher education, believe that the factors of happiness are material, spiritual and social benefits together. It has been proven that young people are generally happier than older people rate, their level of happiness in terms of their role at the University at 4 (on a 5-point scale). It isshown that almost half of the respondents use their time irrationally on the Internet, but they are satisfied with it; most of the respondents would feel happier if they used their time as productively as possible and had the opportunity to spend more time on self-development and creativity. ; \u041e\u043f\u0438\u0441\u0430\u043d\u043e http:\/\/visnuk-archiv.ubs.edu.ua\/article\/view\/208380","identifier":"http:\/\/visnuk-archiv.ubs.edu.ua\/article\/view\/208380","title":"MEASUREMENTS OF HAPPINESS AT THE UNIVERSITY IN THE CONTEXT OF THE ECONOMY OF HAPPINESS ; \u0412\u0418\u041c\u0406\u0420\u0418 \u0429\u0410\u0421\u0422\u042f \u0412 \u0423\u041d\u0406\u0412\u0415\u0420\u0421\u0418\u0422\u0415\u0422\u0406 \u0412 \u041a\u041e\u041d\u0422\u0415\u041a\u0421\u0422\u0406 \u0415\u041a\u041e\u041d\u041e\u041c\u0406\u041a\u0418 \u0429\u0410\u0421\u0422\u042f","paper_abstract":"The article describes theoretical, methodological approaches to defining and measuring the economy of happiness. The theoretical basis of the economy of happiness involves the study of economic and other factors that determine human happiness, its dependence on the level of economic development of the country and determine the parameters for assessing the level of happiness of society as a whole. The \u00abEasterlin paradox\u00bb is highlighted, which notes the limited impact of economic growth on the level of happiness of citizens. Theeconomy of happiness at the macro level is due to happiness at the micro level, in our study - at the University. Its purpose was to determine the level and measure the factors of happiness, and their impact, taking into account modern network communications on the productivity and creativity of students and teachers. The article presents the results of a study of 323 students and teachers of various higher education institutions of Ukraine, interviewed using a cloud questionary created using Google Form. The results of the study showed that most students and teachers are satisfied with life in higher education, believe that the factors of happiness are material, spiritual and social benefits together. It has been proven that young people are generally happier than older people rate, their level of happiness in terms of their role at the University at 4 (on a 5-point scale). It isshown that almost half of the respondents use their time irrationally on the Internet, but they are satisfied with it; most of the respondents would feel happier if they used their time as productively as possible and had the opportunity to spend more time on self-development and creativity. ; \u041e\u043f\u0438\u0441\u0430\u043d\u043e \u0442\u0435\u043e\u0440\u0435\u0442\u0438\u0447\u043d\u0456 \u0456 \u043c\u0435\u0442\u043e\u0434\u043e\u043b\u043e\u0433\u0456\u0447\u043d\u0456 \u043f\u0456\u0434\u0445\u043e\u0434\u0438 http:\/\/jurnal.radenfatah.ac.id\/index.php\/psikis\/article\/view\/4692; doi:10.19109\/psikis.v6i1.4692","identifier":"http:\/\/jurnal.radenfatah.ac.id\/index.php\/psikis\/article\/view\/4692; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.19109\/psikis.v6i1.4692","title":"THE VARIOUSITY OF HAPPINESS PERSPECTIVE AND ITS IMPLEMENTATION IN LEARNING PROCESS","paper_abstract":"Happiness is the ultimate goal of all activities. The desire for happiness makes humans look for the source of happiness that its existence is worthy of several elements of life. Education as one of the crucial elements of life has varied learning models that can increase the willingness of students to learn. The conscious effort to learn becomes more optimal in a happy psychological condition. This research discusses the ultimate happiness in the Koran described with scientific theories of happiness and explains the Quantum theory of happiness in the learning model. The research method used was literature study and content analysis as the data analysis technique. The results of this study indicate that first, happiness in the Koran was not caused by wealth but our faith as a believer. Second, there are endorphins in humans that emit happiness and calmness. Third, someone who is happy will have a change in thoughts, words, actions, facial expressions, and positive muscle activity. Fourth, the learning model that can create happy learning begins with creating happy emotions, giving both material and non-material rewards, and good habituation. Fifth, the understanding about happiness from various perspectives can provide a variety of positive developments in all aspects of life and will lead into a better life.","published_in":"Psikis : Jurnal Psikologi Islami; Vol 6 No 1 (2020): Psikis : Jurnal Psikologi Islami; 102-115 ; Psikis; Vol 6 No 1 (2020): Psikis : Jurnal Psikologi Islami; 102-115 ; 2549-6468 ; 2502-728X","year":"2020-06-01","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Zuhdiyah, Zuhdiyah; Karolina, Asri; Oviyanti, Fitri; Aflisia, Noza; Hardiyanti, Yesa Satriya Dwi","link":"http:\/\/jurnal.radenfatah.ac.id\/index.php\/psikis\/article\/view\/4692","oa_state":"1","url":"d07f432e5fe2f80ab156eb628ff43b6db682f524c15c54a0f0af4f089c96c9dd","relevance":72,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"8950f8dd07b44be72e039bb0da40a76e7da149cce8dec57d40e12babd7e72dcf","relation":"https:\/\/www.dovepress.com\/the-mediating-role-of-positive-and-negative-affects-in-the-relationshi-peer-reviewed-article-PRBM; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/1179-1578; 1179-1578; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/e67b1b9e731c475c990dc623f680251c","identifier":"https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/e67b1b9e731c475c990dc623f680251c","title":"The Mediating Role of Positive and Negative Affects in the Relationship Between Self-Esteem and Happiness","paper_abstract":"Carlos Salavera,1,2 Pablo Us\u00e1n,1,2 Pilar Teruel1,2 1Research Group OPIICS, University of Zaragoza, Zaragoza, Spain; 2Faculty of Education, University of Zaragoza, Zaragoza, SpainCorrespondence: Carlos SalaveraFaculty of Education, University of Zaragoza, c\/Pedro Cerbuna, 12, Zaragoza 50009, SpainEmail salavera@unizar.esBackground: Affects, both positive and negative, can act as mediators between self-esteem and happiness. The present study is undertaken among 812 university students in order to examine the relationship between these variables.Methods: The sample included 812 university students \u2013 361 men (44.46%) and 451 women (55.54%) \u2013 who participated voluntarily. The Positive and Negative Affect Scale, Subjective Happiness Scale and Self-Esteem Scale were the instruments used in this study.Results: The results revealed that men have greater self-esteem and positive affects, while women scored higher in terms of subjective happiness. The analysis revealed a significant correlation between the variables under analysis. Positive affects show a strong positive correlation between self-esteem and happiness, while negative affects show a negative correlation. Mediation analysis suggests that affects, both positive and negative, mediate the relationship between self-esteem and subjective happiness. The results of this study may present us with new perspectives concerning the role that affects play between self-esteem and happiness.Conclusion: The data present evidence of the mediating role-played by affects, both positive and negative, in the relationship between self-esteem and happiness. More research is needed to examine to what extent these results can be extrapolated, and how to design measures to improve psychological health and well-being.Keywords: positive affects, negative affects, self-esteem, happiness, mediation","published_in":"Psychology Research and Behavior Management, Vol Volume 13, Pp 355-361 (2020)","year":"2020-04-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"positive affects; negative affects; self-esteem; happiness; mediation; Psychology; BF1-990; Industrial psychology; HF5548.7-5548.85","subject":"positive affects; negative affects; self-esteem; happiness; mediation; Psychology;  Industrial psychology;; 7-","authors":"Salavera C; Us\u00e1n P; Teruel P","link":"https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/e67b1b9e731c475c990dc623f680251c","oa_state":"1","url":"8950f8dd07b44be72e039bb0da40a76e7da149cce8dec57d40e12babd7e72dcf","relevance":71,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"1b12bacfa579052b042f09e221f351743cd3d495cc980e7cd48771cad30ad8b9","relation":"http:\/\/www.infad.eu\/RevistaINFAD\/OJS\/index.php\/IJODAEP\/article\/view\/1871; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/0214-9877; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/2603-5987; 0214-9877; 2603-5987; doi:10.17060\/ijodaep.2020.n1.v2.1871; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/3359667b82f1440a85d333eb3a360028","identifier":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.17060\/ijodaep.2020.n1.v2.1871; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/3359667b82f1440a85d333eb3a360028","title":"The dimensions of happiness within the Oxford happiness questionnaire: developing a valid multidimensional measurement instrument for a portuguese sample","paper_abstract":"The evidence that individuals\u2019 happiness and general well-being are closely related has made happiness a frequently studied topic in the last decades. Studies showed that happiness has several dimensions and that these are dependent, amongst others, of cultural, economic, and social factors. The aim of this study was to validate a measure that identifies possible dimensions of happiness having as a starting point the Oxford Happiness Questionnaire. An online questionnaire with socio-professional items and the Oxford Happiness Questionnaire was used. A sample of 1032 individuals from several Portuguese higher education establishments was collected, of which 581 (56.3%) were students, 257 (24.9%) were faculty members, and 194 (18.8%) were non-teaching staff. The sample was divided into two subsamples: sample 1 (n=508) and sample 2 (n=524). A Principal Components Analysis (PCA) was performed on sample 1, followed by Covariance Based Structural Equation Modelling (CB-SEM) on sample 2. The PCA presented results, consistent with the existing theory, for a three-factor model. CB-SEM identified several items with significant correlations with more than one latent variable, which eliminated from the model. A valid model (CFI= .95; TLI= .94; AGFI= .95; RMSEA= .04) was obtained, with three dimensions: Joy (six items); Positivism (nine items); and Reliability (two items). We conclude that a threedimension model is valid for the population under study and should be applied to other populations to deepen the conclusions. These three dimensions may serve as a basis to better understand what influences our happiness and propose interventions to promote it.","published_in":"INFAD, Vol 2, Iss 1, Pp 465-478 (2020)","year":"2020-06-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"happiness; joy; positivism; reliability; higher education; Psychology; BF1-990","subject":"happiness; joy; positivism; reliability; higher education; Psychology; ","authors":"Ana Galv\u00e3o; Sa\u00fal Neves de Jesus; Marco Pinheiro; Jo\u00e3o Viseu","link":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.17060\/ijodaep.2020.n1.v2.1871","oa_state":"1","url":"1b12bacfa579052b042f09e221f351743cd3d495cc980e7cd48771cad30ad8b9","relevance":70,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.17060\/ijodaep.2020.n1.v2.1871"},{"id":"711b762dffd24660c4dfcc5b615d819858bd7fec8db334c81d5ca7a45a1e9cb5","relation":"http:\/\/doisrpska.nub.rs\/index.php\/OIK\/article\/view\/6683\/6549; http:\/\/doisrpska.nub.rs\/index.php\/OIK\/article\/view\/6683; doi:10.2478\/eoik-2019-0014","identifier":"http:\/\/doisrpska.nub.rs\/index.php\/OIK\/article\/view\/6683; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.2478\/eoik-2019-0014","title":"CAN SLEEP DURATION HELP EXPLAIN DIFFERENCES IN THE HAPPINESS INDEX ACROSS NATIONS?","paper_abstract":"Inadequate sleep is an important public health problem that can affect one in every three adults;however, it received little attention in the economics of happiness research. The objective ofthis article is to examine whether sleep adequacy contributes to the explanation of variation inhappiness index levels across countries. Analysis was undertaken using ordinary least squaresregression method. The dependent variable is the self-reported happiness index developed by theGallup poll and published in the World Happiness Report. Two alternative model specificationswere used. The first included average sleep minutes per country, GDP per capita(purchasingpower parity), unemployment rate, and environmental performance index. The second modelspecification included average sleep minutes per country, GDP (purchasing power parity), andeconomic freedom index. Both model specifications met several robustness checks, and showedoverall significance and significant coefficients. Results showed that an increase in average sleepduration by 10 minutes is associated with an improvement in the happiness score by 0.1 and 0.15points in the first and second model specifications respectively, noting an average happiness scoreof 6.2 in the country sample. The conclusion that sleep duration contributes to explaining variationin happiness levels across countries is a call for policy makers to consider policies targetingimprovement in sleep adequacy as priority, and to direct more resources to further research inthe area of sleep economics. Previous studies in the area of happiness economics did not considersleep in explaining differences in happiness among countries, and previous studies in the area ofeconomics of sleep did not consider the happiness index at a global level.","published_in":"ECONOMICS - \u010cASOPIS ZA INOVACIJSKA I EKONOMSKA ISTRA\u017dIVANJA; \u0421\u0432\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0430 7, \u0411\u0440. 2 (2019): ECONOMICS ; 2303-5013 ; 2303-5005","year":"2020-06-03","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Mohamed Kamal, Azza","link":"http:\/\/doisrpska.nub.rs\/index.php\/OIK\/article\/view\/6683","oa_state":"1","url":"711b762dffd24660c4dfcc5b615d819858bd7fec8db334c81d5ca7a45a1e9cb5","relevance":69,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"7fe25e475ac22ff400c2727f3baca260b7cad235e3376c91324171ed654c4818","relation":"https:\/\/www.mdpi.com\/1660-4601\/17\/11\/4053; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/1661-7827; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/1660-4601; doi:10.3390\/ijerph17114053; 1660-4601; 1661-7827; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/68c9c08b06df4f58a46e76d91c5a7f7e","identifier":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3390\/ijerph17114053; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/68c9c08b06df4f58a46e76d91c5a7f7e","title":"When Do Good Deeds Lead to Good Feelings? Eudaimonic Orientation Moderates the Happiness Benefits of Prosocial Behavior","paper_abstract":"Engaging in prosocial behavior is considered an effective way to increase happiness in a sustainable manner. However, there is insufficient knowledge about the conditions under which such a happiness effect occurs. From a person-activity congruence perspective, we proposed that an individual\u2019s eudaimonic orientation moderates the effect of prosocial behavior on happiness, whereas hedonic orientation does not. For this purpose, 128 participants were assigned to play a game in which half of them were explained the benevolence impact of playing the game (the benevolence condition), and the other half played the same game without this knowledge (the control condition). Participants\u2019 eudaimonic and hedonic orientations were assessed before the game, and their post-task happiness were measured after the game. The results showed that participants in the benevolence condition reported higher post-task positive affect than those in the control condition. Furthermore, this happiness effect was moderated by participants\u2019 eudaimonic orientation\u2014participants with high eudaimonic orientation reaped greater benefits from benevolence, and their hedonic orientation did not moderate the relationship between benevolence and happiness. The importance of the effect of person-activity congruence on happiness is discussed, along with the implications of these findings for sustainably pursuing happiness.","published_in":"International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health, Vol 17, Iss 4053, p 4053 (2020)","year":"2020-06-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"happiness; prosocial behavior; eudaimonic orientation; hedonic orientation; person-activity congruence; Medicine; R","subject":"happiness; prosocial behavior; eudaimonic orientation; hedonic orientation; person-activity congruence; Medicine; R","authors":"Weipeng Lai; Zhixu Yang; Yanhui Mao; Qionghan Zhang; Hezhi Chen; Jianhong Ma","link":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3390\/ijerph17114053","oa_state":"1","url":"7fe25e475ac22ff400c2727f3baca260b7cad235e3376c91324171ed654c4818","relevance":68,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3390\/ijerph17114053"},{"id":"35e4e9b9ab68036874246eb850bf82438df61d8836c033f16422a2b7ab6e7a7b","relation":"https:\/\/jurnal.ugm.ac.id\/jpsi\/article\/view\/47634; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/0215-8884; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/2460-867X; doi:10.22146\/jpsi.47634; 0215-8884; 2460-867X; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/5540b07d830649babc29af7b17dce09e","identifier":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.22146\/jpsi.47634; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/5540b07d830649babc29af7b17dce09e","title":"Quality of Life as A Predictor of Happiness and Life Satisfaction","paper_abstract":"This study aimed to find correlations between the quality of life, happiness, and life satisfaction of the general population of Bandung city. There were 370 participants with averageage of 20.7 years, mostly male (55.7%) and with a secondary level of education (SMP-SMA; 57.0%) who completed three questionnaires: (i) WHOQOL-BREF to measure quality of life, (ii) Happiness Thermometer to measure happiness, and (iii) Self-Anchoring Cantril Striving Scale to measure life satisfaction. Multiple linear regression tests were used with happiness and life satisfaction as dependent variables and quality of life as an independent variable. The results showed that the psychological and physical domains of quality of life were significant predictors of happiness and satisfaction of life, where the psychological domain proved significant in predicting all four-time points: happiness today (\u03b2=0.039; p<0.05), happiness throughout life (\u03b2=0.043; p<0.05), current life satisfaction (\u03b2=0.034; p<0.05) and life satisfaction five years from now (\u03b2=0.017; p<0.05). Physical domain was similar to psychological except for current life satisfaction (\u03b2=0.029; 0.023; 0.014; p<0.05). The environmental domain had been shown to predict happiness throughout life significantly (\u03b2=0.019; p<0.05) and life satisfaction five years from now (\u03b2=-0.015; p<0.05). The social domain was not found to be a significant predictor. It can be concluded that improving the psychological and physical function of Indonesian people and their environmental conditions will lead them to a happier and more satisfying life.","published_in":"Jurnal Psikologi, Vol 47, Iss 2, Pp 93-103 (2020)","year":"2020-08-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"quality of life; happiness; indonesia; life satisfaction; Psychology; BF1-990","subject":"quality of life; happiness; indonesia; life satisfaction; Psychology; ","authors":"Langgersari Elsari Novianti; Esti Wungu; Fredrick Dermawan Purba","link":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.22146\/jpsi.47634","oa_state":"1","url":"35e4e9b9ab68036874246eb850bf82438df61d8836c033f16422a2b7ab6e7a7b","relevance":67,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.22146\/jpsi.47634"},{"id":"a30161a76eaf36e8aad4068acf8f73781607f46e89acd2ef8d4bd8dff79ec44b","relation":"https:\/\/www.frontiersin.org\/article\/10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01931\/full; https:\/\/doaj.org\/toc\/1664-1078; 1664-1078; doi:10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01931; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/c6aebae02f194c1c98fd6206bb2d3666","identifier":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01931; https:\/\/doaj.org\/article\/c6aebae02f194c1c98fd6206bb2d3666","title":"Authentic Happiness at Work: Self- and Peer-Rated Orientations to Happiness, Work Satisfaction, and Stress Coping","paper_abstract":"The authentic happiness theory covers three basic orientations to happiness; namely, the life of pleasure (via hedonism); engagement (via flow-related experiences); and meaning (via eudaimonia). There is broad evidence for a positive relationship between these three orientations and indicators of positive psychological functioning in a variety of life domains. However, their contribution to well-being at work is understudied. The main aim of this study was testing the relationship between self- and peer-rated orientations to happiness, work related well-being (work satisfaction, work stress), and coping strategies. Further possible mediating effects of the coping strategies on the relationship between orientations to happiness and well-being at work were also examined. The sample consisted of 372 German-speaking Swiss adults (60.3% female), aged between 18 and 65 years (M = 38.9, SD = 10.8) with a minimum of 40% full-time employment. For 100 persons, peer-ratings of the orientations to happiness were available. Our results showed that the life of engagement and, to a lesser extent, the life of meaning are related to work satisfaction. The life of pleasure was associated with lower levels of reported work stress. Further, positive associations between self- and peer-rated orientations to happiness (particularly pleasure) and adaptive coping strategies with stress were also found. Mediation analyses showed that the effects of engagement in general and content-related work satisfaction were mediated mainly by control and negative coping, while the association between meaning and resigned work satisfaction was mediated by positive coping. Negative coping fully mediated the association between the pleasurable life and work stress. Overall, our results indicate that employees\u2019 orientations to happiness are of importance for experiencing well-being at work.","published_in":"Frontiers in Psychology, Vol 11 (2020)","year":"2020-08-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"coping; orientations to happiness; positive psychology; work satisfaction; work stress; Psychology; BF1-990","subject":"coping; orientations to happiness; positive psychology; work satisfaction; work stress; Psychology; ","authors":"Nancy Tandler; Annette Krauss; Ren\u00e9 T. Proyer","link":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01931","oa_state":"1","url":"a30161a76eaf36e8aad4068acf8f73781607f46e89acd2ef8d4bd8dff79ec44b","relevance":66,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":"https:\/\/doi.org\/10.3389\/fpsyg.2020.01931"},{"id":"dfae1363bb1db032740171a92c2a0a43d07ad2ff9b1aa7c90bb99160bb993b86","relation":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/download\/article-file\/1173102; https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/tudear\/issue\/55343\/759160","identifier":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/tudear\/issue\/55343\/759160","title":"Mutluluk Tarihi ; History Of Happiness","paper_abstract":"Antik \u00c7a\u011f\u2019dan g\u00fcn\u00fcm\u00fcze d\u00fc\u015f\u00fcnce sistemlerinin, kadim inan\u00e7lar\u0131n ve ilahi vahiylerin \u00f6nceledikleri konulardan biri olan mutluluk, birey ve toplumlar\u0131n nihai ama\u00e7lar\u0131ndan biri olmas\u0131 nedeniyle her \u00e7a\u011fda g\u00fcndemini korumaktad\u0131r. \u0130nsanla birlikte tarih sahnesinde varl\u0131k bulan mutlulu\u011fa \u00f6zg\u00fc bir tarih \u00e7izelgesi bulunmaktad\u0131r. Tarihsel s\u00fcre\u00e7te ya\u015fanan her t\u00fcrl\u00fc de\u011fi\u015fim ve d\u00f6n\u00fc\u015f\u00fcm\u00fcn mutlulu\u011fa y\u00fcklenen anlamlar\u0131 etkiledi\u011fi g\u00f6r\u00fclmektedir. Her \u00e7a\u011f kendi perspektifine g\u00f6re mutluluk tecr\u00fcbesini ya\u015famakta ve bu tecr\u00fcbeyi yorumlamaktad\u0131r. \u0130lk \u00c7a\u011f\u2019da Tanr\u0131lar\u0131n hediyesi veya \u015fans olarak g\u00f6r\u00fclen, Orta \u00c7a\u011f\u2019da teolojinin belirledi\u011fi alan i\u00e7erisinde ya\u015fan\u0131laca\u011f\u0131 kabul edilen mutluluk, modern donemde s\u0131n\u0131rlar\u0131n\u0131 bireyin tayin etti\u011fi bir durum olarak ya\u015fanmaktad\u0131r. Modern anlay\u0131\u015fa g\u00f6re mutluluk, bireyin arzu ve isteklerinin tatmin edilmesi tasavvuruyla \u015fekillenmektedir. Bu makalede Antik \u00c7a\u011f\u2019dan g\u00fcn\u00fcm\u00fcze de\u011fi\u015fim ve d\u00f6n\u00fc\u015f\u00fcm s\u00fcre\u00e7leriyle mutluluk tarihi anlat\u0131lmaktad\u0131r. ; From the First Age up to now, happiness, which is one of the priorities of thought systems, ancient beliefs and divine revelations, maintains its agenda in every age as it is a feeling that every individual desires to reach. There is a timetable specific to the happiness that exists on the stage of history with human beings. All kinds of changes and transformations in the historical process affect the meanings attributed to happiness. Each era experiences happiness and interprets this experience according to its own perspective. Happiness, which was seen as a gift or chance of the Gods in the First Age and accepted to be experienced within the field determined by theology in the Middle Ages, is experienced as an emotion determined by the individual in the modern era. According to modern understanding, happiness is shaped by the idea of satisfying the desires and desires of the individual. This article describes the history of happiness with the processes of change and transformation from Antiquity to the present day.","published_in":"Issue: 9 217-243 ; 2149-9845 ; 2636-7807 ; T\u00fcrkiye Din E\u011fitimi Ara\u015ft\u0131rmalar\u0131 Dergisi","year":"2020-06-27T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"Mutluluk,Ahlak,Mutluluk Tarihi,Mutluluk Ahlak\u0131,Modern; Happiness,Morality,History of happiness,Eudaimonia,Modern","subject":"Mutluluk,Ahlak,Mutluluk Tarihi,Mutluluk Ahlak\u0131,Modern; Happiness,Morality,History of happiness,Eudaimonia,Modern","authors":"YALVA\u00c7 ARICI, Handan","link":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/tudear\/issue\/55343\/759160","oa_state":"2","url":"dfae1363bb1db032740171a92c2a0a43d07ad2ff9b1aa7c90bb99160bb993b86","relevance":65,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"8a7178f5069625d85794272db9627207b98eef06f1a427957e30d6557165cd88","relation":"http:\/\/ejournal.umm.ac.id\/index.php\/jep\/article\/view\/11366\/pdf; http:\/\/ejournal.umm.ac.id\/index.php\/jep\/article\/downloadSuppFile\/11366\/1562; http:\/\/ejournal.umm.ac.id\/index.php\/jep\/article\/downloadSuppFile\/11366\/1563; http:\/\/ejournal.umm.ac.id\/index.php\/jep\/article\/view\/11366; doi:10.22219\/jep.v18i1.11366","identifier":"http:\/\/ejournal.umm.ac.id\/index.php\/jep\/article\/view\/11366; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.22219\/jep.v18i1.11366","title":"Effects of Happiness Levels in Asia","paper_abstract":"Happiness is the main goal in life. To measure someone's happiness is not easy, many opinions have emerged. Some say happiness can be measured through the satisfaction of one's life, some say happiness is measured through one's income, education, and health. The number of people's opinions to measure one's happiness appears as an indicator of happiness. At present, there are 48 indicators. One of the most accurate is HPI. The HPI indicator is very important for a country to increase the happiness of its people. Example: life expectancy in a country will increase and unemployment will decrease because a person has extensive knowledge and knowledge that is needed both by himself and the company that will accept him as his employee. The purpose of this study is to find out how HDI influences, life expectancy, unemployment on the level of happiness of people in ASIA. In this study using secondary data sources conducted by taking HDI data, life expectancy, unemployment in ASIA, and HPI data on ASIA. The results of the analysis using quantitative methods indicate that the independent variables namely HDI, life expectancy, and unemployment. Has a significant positive effect on the HPI dependent variable.","published_in":"Jurnal Ekonomi Pembangunan; Vol 18, No 1 (2020): JURNAL EKONOMI PEMBANGUNAN; 51-61 ; 2527-4023 ; 1693-2595","year":"2020-06-30","subject_orig":"Happiness Indek; HDI; Life Expectacy and Unemployment","subject":"Happiness Indek; HDI; Life Expectacy and Unemployment","authors":"Firmansyah, Rully; Wulansari, Dyah","link":"http:\/\/ejournal.umm.ac.id\/index.php\/jep\/article\/view\/11366","oa_state":"1","url":"8a7178f5069625d85794272db9627207b98eef06f1a427957e30d6557165cd88","relevance":64,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"43024078a2d4a88fe0b603b9f507340dc40f29a68eea7aeca314fd332cf0fb08","relation":"http:\/\/journals.hnpu.edu.ua\/index.php\/lingvistics\/article\/view\/3026\/3052; http:\/\/journals.hnpu.edu.ua\/index.php\/lingvistics\/article\/view\/3026; doi:10.34142\/23127546.2020.52.03","identifier":"http:\/\/journals.hnpu.edu.ua\/index.php\/lingvistics\/article\/view\/3026; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.34142\/23127546.2020.52.03","title":"SYNONYMIC RANGE TO THE WORD \u201cHAPPINESS\u201d IN THE UKRAINIAN LANGUAGE ; \u0421\u0418\u041d\u041e\u041d\u0406\u041c\u0406\u0427\u041d\u0418\u0419 \u0420\u042f\u0414 \u0414\u041e \u0421\u041b\u041e\u0412\u0410 \u0429\u0410\u0421\u0422\u042f \u0412 \u0423\u041a\u0420\u0410\u0407\u041d\u0421\u042c\u041a\u0406\u0419 \u041c\u041e\u0412\u0406","paper_abstract":"The synonym for the word happiness has not been considered yet in detail, that determines the scientific novelty and relevance of the study. The analysis of lexicographic sources demonstrates the synonymic series of the happiness token. The analysis and comparison of the tokens that belong to one synonymous series have been done.The object of the study is a gentle zone of meanings embedded in the concept of happiness in the Ukrainian language, the subject of which is the constituents of the synonym for the word happiness. The purpose of our study is to select synonymous tokens for the word happiness, perform a component analysis of these tokens and identify common semantic characteristics that allow us to form a synonymous series with the dominant of happiness.To achieve this goal, the following tasks are formulated: 1) to define synonyms for the word happiness; 2) to organize and classify them; 3) to determine the contextual significance of the identified synonymous units and the peculiarities of their functioning in the language world map of the Ukrainian world.To achieve this goal, the following methods were used: continuous sampling (to obtain the body of the necessary synonyms), descriptive method (to qualify the features of lexical filling), component analysis (to identify features of the semantic structure of the synonymous series), as well as elements of quantitative calculation (to refine the results research). Various uses of synonyms and their semantic doublets are investigated, special attention is paid to the description of synonyms within the vocabulary. In the course of the study, 15 vocabularies were analyzed and a semantic row for the word happiness was distinguished. It has been found that the word happiness has 23 synonyms (\u0437\u0430\u0434\u043e\u0432\u043e\u043b\u0435\u043d\u043d\u044f \/pleasure\/, \u0431\u043b\u0430\u0433\u043e\u0434\u0430\u0442\u044c \/grace\/, \u0431\u043b\u0430\u0436\u0435\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \/bliss\/, \u0442\u0430\u043b\u0430\u043d\u0442 \/talent\/, \u0440\u0430\u0439 \/paradise\/, \u0440\u0430\u044e\u0432\u0430\u043d\u043d\u044f \/paradise\/, \u0433\u0430\u0440\u0430\u0437\u0434\u0438 \/good\/, \u0443\u0434\u0430\u0447\u0430 \/luck\/, \u0431\u043b\u0430\u0433\u043e\u043f\u043e\u043b\u0443\u0447\u0447\u044f \/prosperity\/, \u0431\u043b\u0430\u0433\u043e \/good\/, \u0431\u043b\u0430\u0433\u043e\u0434\u0435\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \/prosperity\/, \u0444\u043e\u0440\u0442\u0443\u043d\u0430 \/fortune\/, \u0434\u043e\u043b\u044f \/ fate\/, \u0449\u0430\u0441\u0442\u044f-\u0434\u043e\u043b\u044f \/happiness-fate\/, \u0440\u0430\u0434\u0456\u0441\u0442\u044c \/joy\/, \u0434\u043e\u0441\u044f\u0433\u043d\u0435\u043d\u043d\u044f \/achievement\/, \u0443\u0441\u043f\u0456\u0445 \/success\/, \u0442\u0430\u043b\u0430\u043d \/talent\/, \u0440\u043e\u0437\u043a\u0456\u0448 \/luxury\/, \u0436\u0435\u0440\u0435\u0431 \/lot\/, \u0441\u043e\u043b\u043e\u0434\u043e\u0449\u0456 \/sweets\/, \u043f\u0440\u0438\u0437\u043d\u0430\u0447\u0435\u043d\u043d\u044f \/destination\/. The synonyms analysis for the word happiness has demonstrated its semantic diversity. The word happiness has semantic doubles \u2013 joy and fate, although the last one has lost the meaning lately; there is some controversy over the description of the semantics of the following words such as \u0442\u0430\u043b\u0430\u043d\u0442 (talent) and \u0442\u0430\u043b\u0430\u043d (luck), as different vocabulary articles define their interchangeability differently.Key words: token of doi:10.1037\/mot0000143","identifier":"https:\/\/ir.library.carleton.ca\/pub\/27390; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1037\/mot0000143","title":"Simple pleasures: How goal-aligned behaviors relate to state happiness","paper_abstract":"Goal progress has been consistently linked to subjective well-being and happiness (Klug & Maier, 2015), but do the individual actions of doing something helpful for personal goals have similar effects? The current study investigates how goal alignment-the perception that you are engaging in activities that are aligned with personal goals-might be associated with state happiness. We hypothesized that people will feel happier when the activities they are performing are aligned with their goals. The study also explored the roles of goal progress and competence in this relation. Data on goal-activity alignment, goal progress, competence, and state happiness were collected in an experience-sampling study with undergraduate students (N = 159) and a survey study with Amazon MTurk workers (N = 252). Using multilevel analyses and regression analyses, results indicated that participants were happier when they were pursuing activities that were more closely aligned with their goals than when pursuing less goal-aligned activities; the results remained significant after accounting for goal progress. Participants who were more goal aligned on average reported greater state happiness; this effect was nonsignificant when goal progress was accounted for. Results suggest that goal alignment has a significant and unique effect on state happiness and that goal pursuit has very immediate benefits that begin as soon as individuals start doing actions helpful for their personal goals.","published_in":"Motivation Science vol. 6 no. 2, pp. 156-163","year":"2020-06-01","subject_orig":"Experience sampling; Goal alignment; State happiness","subject":"Experience sampling; Goal alignment; State happiness","authors":"Wang, J.F. The Mediating Role of Service-Skill Use","paper_abstract":"The purpose of this paper is to examine the relationship between happiness at work and cross-selling performance in the banking sector. In addition, the mediating effect of service-skill use is analyzed in the relationship between happiness at work and performance. Confirmatory factor analysis is used by means of structural equation models to assess the relationship between happiness at work, service-skill use, and cross-selling performance. A sample of 492 financial service employees is examined. Results reveal that happiness at work positively and directly affects cross-selling performance. The study also shows that service-skill use plays a partial mediating role in the relationship between happiness at work and cross-selling performance. This research expands the theory of the happy productive worker perspective based on the job demands-resources model and defines and conceptualizes service-skill use. Employees who are happier at work cross-sell better, but their service-skill use mediates the effect of happiness at work on cross-selling performance.","published_in":"Frontiers in Psychology, Vol 11 (2020)","year":"2020-03-01T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"happiness at work; service-skill use; performance; affective organizational commitment; job satisfaction; engagement; Psychology; BF1-990","subject":"happiness at work; service-skill use; performance; affective organizational commitment; job satisfaction; engagement; Psychology; ","authors":"Andr\u00e9s Salas-Vallina; Manoli Pozo-Hidalgo; Pedro R. These effects will be seen in the gender role of husband and wife in solving problems in fishermen\u2019s families. This study aims to analyze the effect of gender roles and coping strategies on fishermen\u2019s family happiness index. The study design used a cross-sectional study with interviews and questionnaire assistance. The research sample was selected by purposive sampling with respondents of 40 fishermen\u2019s families in the Toboali District, Bangka Belitung Islands Province. The gender role variables, coping strategies, and fishermen\u2019s family happiness index are in the medium category. There is a correlation between coping strategies with the happiness index of fishermen\u2019s families. Although in the present-day human resource professionals accept the essentiality of sound human resource management and employee happiness in achieving organizational strategic objectives successfully, they are continuously struggling to assess these two areas as there is a knowledge gap on measuring instruments. This study was carried out to address the contextual niche on measuring human resource practices along with employee happiness and aimed to answer three research questions as there is a significant need to assess these areas practically. An extensive inspection of literature has done to answer the research questions of the study i.e. (1) what is HRM? (2) what is employee happiness? (3) how to measure HRM and employee happiness? Dimana konflik peran yang terjadi ini mengakibatkan kelelahan emosional, keletihan, kegelisahan serta frustasi. Akibat dari terkumpulnya emosi negatif ini akan menyebabkan semakin menjauhnya diri mencapai kebahagiaan (happiness). Tujuan dari penelitian ini adalah untuk mengetahui hubungan antara work family conflict dengan happiness pada ibu yang bekerja. Teknik pengambilan sampel menggunakan purposive sampling. Subjek penelitian adalah 91 orang ibu yang bekerja rutin , minimal 8 jam sehari, bekerja dalam intitusi formal (terikat tuntutan organisasi), memiliki minimal 1 anak, dan tidak dibantu siapapun dalam mengurus keluarga. Metode pengambilan data menggunakan skala Work Family Conflict dan skala Authentic Happiness Questionnaire. Uji analisis menggunakan korelasi product moment pearson. Hasil penelitian menunjukkan nilai (r) sebesar -0,183 dengan p sebesar 0,041 < 0,05. Hal ini menunjukkan adanya hubungan negatif yang signifikan antara work family conflict dengan happines.Yang berarti semakin rendah work family conflict maka akan semakin tinggi happiness begitupun sebaliknya semakin tinggi work family conflict makan akan semakin rendah happiness. Changes in the role of experienced by mother cause due to the complexity of and when were not able to fulfill the role of both so mother will experience work family conflict. Where conflict the role of this resulting in emotional exhaustion, weariness, uneasiness and frustrated. Results of negative emotions this will cause the more get themselves reached for happiness. The purpose of this study is to find the relationship between work family conflicts with happiness upon the mother who works. The sampling method of collecting samples using purposive technique. Participants in this study 91 mother whose work is routine, and have minimum one child. A method of the data using a scale work family conflict and scale of authentic happiness questionnaire. The analysis using correlation product moment pearson. Research shows the (r) of -0,183 with p of 0,041 <0,05. This is shows that there was significant negative relationship between work family conflicts with happiness. Studies of the impact of happiness and life satisfaction on life expectancy and mortality in the US are limited or non-existent. Using a national longitudinal dataset, we examined the association between levels of happiness\/life satisfaction and US life expectancy and all-cause mortality. Methods: We analyzed the 2001 National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) prospectively linked to 2001-2014 mortality records in the National Death Index (NDI) (N=30,377). Cox proportional hazards regression was used to model survival time as a function of happiness, life satisfaction, and sociodemographic and behavioral covariates. Results: Life expectancies at age 18 among adults with high levels of happiness and life satisfaction were, respectively, 7.5 and 8.9 years higher compared to those with low levels of happiness and life satisfaction. In Cox models with 14 years of mortality follow-up, all-cause mortality risk was 82% higher (hazard ratio [HR]=1.82; 95% CI=1.59,2.08) in adults with little or no happiness, controlling for age, and 36% higher (HR=1.36; 95% CI=1.17,1.57) in adults with little\/no happiness, controlling for sociodemographic, behavioral and health characteristics, when compared with adults reporting happiness all of the time. Mortality risk was 107% higher (HR=2.07; 95% CI=1.80,2.38) in adults who were very dissatisfied with their life, controlling for age, and 39% higher (HR=1.39; 95% CI=1.20,1.60) in adults who were very dissatisfied, controlling for all covariates, when compared with adults who were very satisfied. Conclusions and Global Health Implications: Adults with higher happiness and life satisfaction levels had significantly higher life expectancy and lower all-cause mortality risks than those with lower happiness and satisfaction levels. These findings underscore the significance of addressing subjective well-being in the population as a strategy for reducing all-cause mortality. Key words: \u2022 Inequalities \u2022 Disparities \u2022 Happiness \u2022 Life satisfaction \u2022 Life expectancy \u2022 Mortality \u2022 Longitudinal \u2022 Social determinants Copyright \u00a9 2020 Lee and Singh. Ara\u015ft\u0131rman\u0131n \u00f6rneklemini, 540 (315\u2019i kad\u0131n, 225\u2019i erkek) bran\u015f \u00f6\u011fretmeni olu\u015fturmaktad\u0131r. Bu \u00e7al\u0131\u015fmada, veri toplama ara\u00e7lar\u0131 olarak ara\u015ft\u0131rmac\u0131 taraf\u0131ndan geli\u015ftirilen \u201cKi\u015fisel Bilgi Formu\u201d \u201cOxford Mutluluk \u00d6l\u00e7e\u011fi K\u0131sa Formu\u201d ve \u201c\u0130yimserlik \u00d6l\u00e7e\u011fi\u201d kullan\u0131lm\u0131\u015ft\u0131r. Yap\u0131lan analizlerde ikili de\u011fi\u015fkenler i\u00e7in t-testi ve \u00e7oklu de\u011fi\u015fkenler i\u00e7in tek y\u00f6nl\u00fc varyans analizi istatistik tekni\u011fi kullan\u0131lm\u0131\u015ft\u0131r. Ara\u015ft\u0131rma bulgular\u0131na g\u00f6re; \u00f6\u011fretmenlerin mutluluk puanlar\u0131nda cinsiyet de\u011fi\u015fkeni a\u00e7\u0131s\u0131ndan anlaml\u0131 bir farkl\u0131l\u0131k g\u00f6r\u00fclmemi\u015ftir. Di\u011fer de\u011fi\u015fkenler olan bran\u015f, mesleki sayg\u0131nl\u0131k alg\u0131s\u0131, mesle\u011fi sevme ve kitap okuma a\u00e7\u0131s\u0131ndan mutluluk puanlar\u0131nda anlaml\u0131 bir farkl\u0131l\u0131k g\u00f6r\u00fclm\u00fc\u015ft\u00fcr. Rehberlik \u00f6\u011fretmenlerinin bran\u015f \u00f6\u011fretmenlerinden, mesle\u011fini sevenlerin sevmeyenlerden, \u00f6\u011fretmenlik mesle\u011fini sayg\u0131n bulanlar\u0131n bulmayanlardan daha y\u00fcksek mutluluk puan\u0131na sahip oldu\u011fu bulunmu\u015ftur. Ayr\u0131ca okunan kitap say\u0131s\u0131n\u0131n artmas\u0131n\u0131n mutluluk \u00fczerinde etkili oldu\u011fu tespit edilmi\u015ftir. \u0130yimserlik ve mutluluk aras\u0131ndaki ili\u015fki incelendi\u011finde .64 d\u00fczeyinde bir ili\u015fkinin oldu\u011fu, ayr\u0131ca iyimserli\u011fin mutlulu\u011fun kadar\u0131n\u0131 yordad\u0131\u011f\u0131 bulgusuna ula\u015f\u0131lm\u0131\u015ft\u0131r. Ara\u015ft\u0131rman\u0131n sonu\u00e7lar\u0131 ilgili literat\u00fcr do\u011frultusunda tart\u0131\u015f\u0131lm\u0131\u015f ve \u00f6neriler sunulmu\u015ftur. ; The purpose of this research is to investigate the relation between teachers\u2019 levels of happiness and optimism and whether happiness changes significantly according to variables of sex, branch, the thought of professional respectability, enjoying the occupation and the situation of reading book or not. The sample of the research is composed of 540 (315 female, 225 male) branch teachers. In this study, \u201cPersonal Information Form\u201d, \u201cOxford Happiness Questionnaire (Short Form)\u201d and \u201c Optimism Scale\u201d were used as data collection tools. T - test for binary variables and ANOVA statistical technique for multiple variables were used in the analyses conducted. According to results of the research; it has not been seen a significant difference in happiness scores of teachers in terms of sex. It has been seen a significant difference in happiness scores in terms of other variables of branch, the thought of professional respectability, enjoying the occupation and the situation of reading book. It has been found that school counsellors have a higher happiness score than branch teachers have, teachers who like their occupations have a higher happiness score than they who do not like their occupations have, teachers who find teaching as a respectable occupation have a higher happiness score than they who do not find teaching as a respectable occupation have. On the other hand, it has been determined that the increase in the number of reading book is effective on happiness. When the relation between optimism and happiness has been investigated, it has been found that there are at a level of .64 relation besides, optimism predicts happiness about 41 percent. The results of the research have been discussed in accordance with the relevant literature and the suggestions have been offered.","published_in":"Volume: 21, Issue: 1 178-192 ; 1300-2899 ; 2149-9683 ; \u0130n\u00f6n\u00fc \u00dcniversitesi E\u011fitim Fak\u00fcltesi Dergisi","year":"2020-04-30T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"Mutluluk,iyimserlik,\u00f6\u011fretmen,mesleki sayg\u0131nl\u0131k alg\u0131s\u0131; Happiness,Optimism,Teacher,Perception of Vocational Respectability","subject":"Mutluluk,iyimserlik,\u00f6\u011fretmen,mesleki sayg\u0131nl\u0131k alg\u0131s\u0131; Happiness,Optimism,Teacher,Perception of Vocational Respectability","authors":"GEN\u00c7, Hulisi; \u015eAH\u0130N, Yahya; ALTUNTA\u015e, Serkan","link":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/inuefd\/issue\/53939\/555345","oa_state":"2","url":"139a1a060835c45b359f5b1d1d56925906e73c50f1d2ae56ed6b90ff91e138eb","relevance":52,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"8304160d6ceb1ad00563b6bbf560be2c57e478699be3a15ba5884b7e7ea98eee","relation":"info:eu-repo\/semantics\/altIdentifier\/doi\/10.2147\/PRBM.S240917; https:\/\/www.dovepress.com\/the-mediating-role-of-positive-and-negative-affects-in-the-relationshi-peer-reviewed-article-PRBM","identifier":"https:\/\/www.dovepress.com\/the-mediating-role-of-positive-and-negative-affects-in-the-relationshi-peer-reviewed-article-PRBM","title":"The Mediating Role of Positive and Negative Affects in the Relationship Between Self-Esteem and Happiness","paper_abstract":"Carlos Salavera,1,2 Pablo Us\u00e1n,1,2 Pilar Teruel1,2 1Research Group OPIICS, University of Zaragoza, Zaragoza, Spain; 2Faculty of Education, University of Zaragoza, Zaragoza, SpainCorrespondence: Carlos SalaveraFaculty of Education, University of Zaragoza, c\/Pedro Cerbuna, 12, Zaragoza 50009, SpainEmail salavera@unizar.esBackground: Affects, both positive and negative, can act as mediators between self-esteem and happiness. The present study is undertaken among 812 university students in order to examine the relationship between these variables.Methods: The sample included 812 university students \u2013 361 men (44.46%) and 451 women (55.54%) \u2013 who participated voluntarily. The Positive and Negative Affect Scale, Subjective Happiness Scale and Self-Esteem Scale were the instruments used in this study.Results: The results revealed that men have greater self-esteem and positive affects, while women scored higher in terms of subjective happiness. The analysis revealed a significant correlation between the variables under analysis. Positive affects show a strong positive correlation between self-esteem and happiness, while negative affects show a negative correlation. Mediation analysis suggests that affects, both positive and negative, mediate the relationship between self-esteem and subjective happiness. The results of this study may present us with new perspectives concerning the role that affects play between self-esteem and happiness.Conclusion: The data present evidence of the mediating role-played by affects, both positive and negative, in the relationship between self-esteem and happiness. More research is needed to examine to what extent these results can be extrapolated, and how to design measures to improve psychological health and well-being.Keywords: positive affects, negative affects, self-esteem, happiness, mediation","published_in":"","year":"2020-04-28","subject_orig":"Psychology Research and Behavior Management","subject":"Psychology Research and Behavior Management","authors":"Salavera,Carlos; Us\u00c3\u00a1n,Pablo; Teruel,Pilar","link":"https:\/\/www.dovepress.com\/the-mediating-role-of-positive-and-negative-affects-in-the-relationshi-peer-reviewed-article-PRBM","oa_state":"1","url":"8304160d6ceb1ad00563b6bbf560be2c57e478699be3a15ba5884b7e7ea98eee","relevance":51,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"afa6be1a0c1574bff9eb6c28f83c43c14403f016238ea30a424b608c4cfaef01","relation":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/download\/article-file\/1052011; https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/iid\/issue\/53743\/553308; doi:10.18394\/iid.553308","identifier":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/iid\/issue\/53743\/553308; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.18394\/iid.553308","title":"Level and Perception of Happiness at Work: A Study on Private Sector Lawyers ; \u00c7al\u0131\u015fma Mutlulu\u011fu D\u00fczeyi ve Alg\u0131s\u0131: \u00d6zel Sekt\u00f6r Avukatlar\u0131 \u00dczerine Bir Ara\u015ft\u0131rma","paper_abstract":"The aim of this article is to measure happiness at work among private sector lawyers and to reveal how they express and perceive happiness at work. To this purpose, a mixed research methodology with 168 private sector attorneys was designed. The average happiness at work of the lawyers was found to be 3.07 on the 5-point Likert scale. Lawyers express their happiness at work with\u201d realizing the potential, working environment conditions, peace, doing the job with pleasure, money \/ income \/ wage\u201d. The general happiness at work of the lawyers who expressed their happiness at work in terms of income \/ money \/ wages has the highest average with 3.24 average. The positive feelings of the lawyers who expressed their happiness at work with revealing \u201cown potential" an are those of the lawyers who expressed their positive feelings with \u201cpeace\u201d; \u201cpeace and money \/ wages \/ income\u201d stated in the lawyers; It is higher than the lawyers who express yapma doing their job with pleasure \u201d. ; Bu \u00e7al\u0131\u015fman\u0131n amac\u0131, \u00f6zel sekt\u00f6r avukatlar\u0131 aras\u0131nda \u00e7al\u0131\u015fma mutlulu\u011funu \u00f6l\u00e7mek, \u00e7al\u0131\u015fma mutlulu\u011funu nas\u0131l ifade ettiklerini ve alg\u0131lad\u0131klar\u0131n\u0131 ortaya koymaktad\u0131r. Bu ama\u00e7la, 168 \u00f6zel sekt\u00f6r avukat\u0131n\u0131n kat\u0131ld\u0131\u011f\u0131 bir karma ara\u015ft\u0131rma y\u00f6ntemi tasarlanm\u0131\u015ft\u0131r. Avukatlar \u00e7al\u0131\u015fma mutlulu\u011funu \u201cpotansiyeli ger\u00e7ekle\u015ftirme, \u00e7al\u0131\u015fma ortam\u0131 ko\u015fullar\u0131, huzur, i\u015fi severek yapma, para\/gelir\/\u00fccret\u201d olarak ifade etmektedir. \u00c7al\u0131\u015fma mutlulu\u011funu gelir\/para\/\u00fccret ile ifade eden avukatlar\u0131n genel \u00e7al\u0131\u015fma mutlulu\u011fu 3,24 ortalama ile di\u011ferlerine g\u00f6re en y\u00fcksek ortalamaya sahiptir. \u00c7al\u0131\u015fma mutlulu\u011funu \u201cpotansiyeli ger\u00e7ekle\u015ftirme\u201d ile ifade eden avukatlar\u0131n olumlu duygular\u0131 \u201chuzur\u201d ile ifade eden avukatlardan; \u201chuzur ve para\/\u00fccret\/gelir\u201d ile ifade eden avukatlar\u0131n ise; \u201ci\u015fini severek yapma\u201d ile ifade eden avukatlardan daha y\u00fcksektir.","published_in":"Volume: 7, Issue: 1 89-104 ; 2148-967X ; \u0130\u015f ve \u0130nsan Dergisi","year":"2020-04-17T00:00:00Z","subject_orig":"Positive Psychology,Happiness at Work,Employer Lawyer,Labor Lawyer,Internal Lawyer; Pozitif Psikoloji,\u00c7al\u0131\u015fma Mutlulu\u011fu,\u0130\u015fveren Avukat,\u0130\u015f\u00e7i Avukat","subject":"Positive Psychology,Happiness at Work,Employer Lawyer,Labor Lawyer,Internal Lawyer; Pozitif Psikoloji,\u00c7al\u0131\u015fma Mutlulu\u011fu,\u0130\u015fveren Avukat,\u0130\u015f\u00e7i Avukat","authors":"TURAN, Nuray","link":"https:\/\/dergipark.org.tr\/tr\/pub\/iid\/issue\/53743\/553308","oa_state":"2","url":"afa6be1a0c1574bff9eb6c28f83c43c14403f016238ea30a424b608c4cfaef01","relevance":50,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"3738dec0e7773e4ef94be544d006a547afd9423601936928c234558188acf0cf","relation":"Employee Relations; Mousa, M., Massoud, H.K. and Ayoubi, R.M. (2020) 'Gender, diversity management perceptions, workplace happiness and organisational citizenship behaviour', Employee Relations: The International Journal.; 0142-5455; http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/10369\/11104; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1108\/ER-10-2019-0385","identifier":"http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/10369\/11104; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1108\/ER-10-2019-0385","title":"Gender, diversity management perceptions, workplace happiness and organizational citizenship behaviour","paper_abstract":"Article published in Employee Relations on 13 May 2020 (online), available at: https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1108\/ER-10-2019-0385. ; Purpose\/ Aim: The purpose of this paper is to investigate whether females have different perceptions of diversity management and workplace happiness compared to their male colleagues. Furthermore, the paper explores whether diversity management perceptions mediates the relationship between workplace happiness and organisational citizenship behaviour. Design\/Methodology\/Approach: A total of 260 questionnaire from a number of public hospitals in Egypt were analysed using both t-test and Structural Equation Modelling. Findings\/ Results: We found that female physicians perceive diversity management policies\/protocols more positively than their male colleagues. Moreover, gender has no or little effect on physicians\u2019 perceptions of workplace happiness. We also found that workplace happiness positively affects physicians\u2019 organisational citizenship behaviour, and finally, diversity management practices can mediate the relationship between workplace happiness and physicians\u2019 organisational citizenship behaviour. Social and practical implications: We believe that managers can raise the feeling of workplace happiness among their staff if they maintain some personal relationships with physicians, care about the physicians\u2019 work\/life balance, promote after work gatherings, initiate coffee time talks, encourage open communication practices and more. Originality: The paper is based on the argument that although employees might be happy in the workplace through (engagement, job satisfaction, affective commitment), however their happiness will be unlikely reflected into a positive organizational citizenship behaviour towards their organisation, except (social exchange theory) they feel or perceive (equity theory) the overall practices of diversity management in that organization positively. Thus, studying the mediating effect of perceptions towards diversity management is mainly our contribution.","published_in":"","year":"2020-05-13","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Mousa, Mohamed; Massoud, Hiba; Ayoubi, Rami M.","link":"http:\/\/hdl.handle.net\/10369\/11104","oa_state":"2","url":"3738dec0e7773e4ef94be544d006a547afd9423601936928c234558188acf0cf","relevance":49,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"2fd4d41a814b519b1d53079cbcfa5a0ce4da60608d845274284a3b20a6e21e0a","relation":"Verrastro, V., Ritella, G., Saladino, V., Pistella, J., Baiocco, R., & Fontanesi, L. International Journal of Emotional Education, 12(1), 48-64.; 20737629; https:\/\/www.um.edu.mt\/library\/oar\/handle\/123456789\/55037","identifier":"https:\/\/www.um.edu.mt\/library\/oar\/handle\/123456789\/55037","title":"Personal and family correlates to happiness amongst Italian children and pre-adolescents","paper_abstract":"This study examines how family functioning, the parent-child relationship and personal factors are related to happiness in 1549 children aged 7 to 14 years old (53% females) in Italy. Children and pre-adolescents completed a set of questionnaires on self-rated happiness, self-concept and loneliness. At least one of their parents filled in questionnaires on family functioning, attachment and their child\u2019s happiness level. No gender differences were found in the direct measure of happiness, but younger participants were happier than older participants, according to both the children\u2019s and parents\u2019 evaluations. Happiness is influenced by positive self-concept, self-esteem and low levels of satisfaction but family functioning does not seem to play a major role. ISSN 1499-2671 (Published online first) (doi:10.1016\/j.jcjd.2020.05.006 <https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1016\/j.jcjd.2020.05.006>)","identifier":"http:\/\/eprints.mdx.ac.uk\/30224\/; https:\/\/eprints.mdx.ac.uk\/30224\/1\/Lafontaine_etal.2020-SpousalSupportAndRelationshipHappinessInPersonsWithType2DiabetesAndTheirSpouses-accepted_manuscript_CanJDiabet.pdf; https:\/\/doi.org\/10.1016\/j.jcjd.2020.05.006","title":"Spousal support and relationship happiness in adults with type 2 diabetes and their spouses","paper_abstract":"Objectives The purpose of this study was to examine the association between the perceptions of spousal support self-efficacy in terms of dietary self-care and relationship happiness. Methods Forty-six couples, in which only one spouse has type 2 diabetes, completed questionnaires on perceptions of spousal support self-efficacy and relationship happiness. Results Using an actor-partner interdependence model, we found that when persons with type 2 diabetes were more confident in their spouse\u2019s ability to provide them with support regarding their dietary self-care, they reported more relationship happiness. We also found that when their spouse without diabetes was more confident in their own abilities to provide such support to their partner, they reported more relationship happiness. However, the person with diabetes\u2019 confidence in their spouse\u2019s support abilities and the spouse\u2019s confidence in their own support abilities were not associated with the other partner\u2019s relationship happiness. Conclusions This study offers a unique dyadic perspective on the determinants of happiness for couples in which one spouse has type 2 diabetes. The perceived quality of spousal support appears to be associated with relationship happiness in committed couples managing diabetes, regardless of the actual support received or provided.","published_in":"","year":"2020-05-17","subject_orig":"","subject":"","authors":"Lafontaine, Marie-France; B\u00e9langer, Claude; Jolin, St\u00e9phanie; Sabourin, St\u00e9phane; Nouwen, Arie","link":"http:\/\/eprints.mdx.ac.uk\/30224\/","oa_state":"1","url":"850f4698c7bfdd9872215edf91b0d6b484f02504adf4e30c9fd61b9dd8afbe28","relevance":47,"resulttype":["Journal\/newspaper article"],"doi":""},{"id":"0d060fb59beb29b92337668b0ec58b00c185a5cff49b01c427e45a774a8010bb","relation":"https:\/\/www.ajol.info\/index.php\/gab\/article\/view\/193518\/182648; https:\/\/www.ajol.info\/index.php\/gab\/article\/view\/193518","identifier":"https:\/\/www.ajol.info\/index.php\/gab\/article\/view\/193518","title":"Prevalence and associated factors of life satisfaction, happiness and optimism among women in Sierra Leone: Results of the 2017 multiple indicator cluster survey","paper_abstract":"The study aimed assess the prevalence and factors associated with life satisfaction and happiness among adolescent and adult women in Iraq. In the nationally representative \u201c2017 Sierra Leone Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS)\u201d, 18006 adolescent and adult women (15-49 years old) responded to questions on life satisfaction, happiness, optimism and social variables. Linear and logistic regression was used to investigate the associations with life satisfaction, happiness and optimism. Life satisfaction was a mean of 5.6 (range 0-10), the prevalence of being very happy was 35.4% and 93.2% thought their life would be netter in one year\u2019s time (optimism). In adjusted linear or logistic regression analyses, having primary or more education, higher wealth status, access to media (owing a mobile phone) and not having a functional difficulty (or disability) were associated with higher life satisfaction, happiness and optimism. Belonging to an \u201cother ethnic group\u201d was positively and currently tobacco use and FGM were negatively associated with both life satisfaction and happiness. Compared to women who had married or entered a union before they were 18 years old, women who got married when they were 18 years and older had a higher life satisfaction and optimism. The study found that majority of Sierra Leonean adolescents and adult women reported being satisfied with their lives, were happy and optimistic.
